de.dfki.omm.impl

Class OMMFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.dfki.omm.impl.OMMFactory

  • public class OMMFactory
extends java.lang.Object
    Factory for OMM creation, handling and destruction.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.lang.String CREDENTIAL_SEPARATOR
      Sequence of special characters used to separate username and password in internal credential representations: ""@@@"".
      static java.lang.String OWNER_BLOCK_ID 
      static java.lang.String OWNER_SEPARATOR
      Sequence of special characters used to separate owner name and credentials in internal owner representations: ""\\|\\|\\|"".

    • Method Detail

      • changeOMMOwnerViaOMSRestInterface

        public static boolean changeOMMOwnerViaOMSRestInterface(java.lang.String omsURL,
                                                        OMMBlock oldOwnerBlock,
                                                        OMMBlock newOwnerBlock)
        Changes the OMM's owner using the REST interface for access.
        Parameters:
        omsURL - URL to the OMM as String.
        oldOwnerBlock - Owner to be replaced as OMMBlock.
        newOwnerBlock - New owner as OMMBlock.
        Returns:
        True, if owner has succesfully been changed.

      • cloneOMMViaOMSRestInterface

        public static boolean cloneOMMViaOMSRestInterface(java.lang.String cloneMemoryURL,
                                                  OMM omm,
                                                  OMMBlock ownerBlock)
        Sends an OMM as XML string to /mgmt/cloneMemory
        Parameters:
        cloneMemoryURL - The OMS's REST path to the cloneMemory node
        omm - The OMM to clone
        ownerBlock - Owner of the cloned OMM
        Returns:
        True, if memory could be cloned on the OMS

      • createEmptyOMM

        public static OMM createEmptyOMM(TypedValue primaryID)
        Creates an OMM without content from its address on the OMS.
        Parameters:
        primaryID - TypedValue containing the primary ID of the empty OMM.
        Returns:
        The new empty OMM.

      • createEmptyOMM

        public static OMM createEmptyOMM(OMMHeader header)
        Creates an OMM without content from its header.
        Parameters:
        header - OMMSecurityHeader for the empty OMM.
        Returns:
        The new empty OMM.

      • createEmptyOMMBlock

        public static OMMBlock createEmptyOMMBlock(OMM baseOMM,
                                           java.net.URI namespace,
                                           OMMMultiLangText title,
                                           OMMEntity creator)
        Creates an OMMBlock without content.
        Parameters:
        baseOMM - OMM to which the block belongs.
        namespace - Namespace for the block as URI.
        title - The block's title as OMMMultiLangText.
        creator - The block's creator as OMMEntity.
        Returns:
        The new empty OMMBlock.

      • createEmptyOMMBlock

        public static OMMBlock createEmptyOMMBlock(OMM baseOMM,
                                           java.net.URI namespace,
                                           OMMMultiLangText title,
                                           OMMEntity creator,
                                           OMMPreviousBlockLink link)
        Creates an OMMBlock without content.
        Parameters:
        baseOMM - OMM to which the block belongs.
        namespace - Namespace for the block as URI.
        title - The block's title as OMMMultiLangText.
        creator - The block's creator as OMMEntity.
        link - A OMMPreviousBlockLink to a previous block.
        Returns:
        The new empty OMMBlock.

      • createEmptyOMMBlock

        public static OMMBlock createEmptyOMMBlock(OMM baseOMM,
                                           java.net.URI namespace,
                                           java.net.URL type,
                                           OMMMultiLangText title,
                                           OMMMultiLangText description,
                                           OMMFormat format,
                                           OMMSubjectCollection subject)
        Creates an OMMBlock without content.
        Parameters:
        baseOMM - OMM to which the block belongs.
        namespace - Namespace for the block as URI.
        type - The block's type as URL.
        title - The block's title as OMMMultiLangText.
        description - The block's description as OMMMultiLangText.
        format - The block's format as OMMFormat.
        subject - The block's subject as OMMSubjectCollection.
        Returns:
        The new empty OMMBlock.

      • createEmptyOMMBlock

        public static OMMBlock createEmptyOMMBlock(OMM baseOMM,
                                           java.net.URI namespace,
                                           java.net.URL type,
                                           OMMMultiLangText title,
                                           OMMFormat format)

        title - The block's title as OMMMultiLangText.
        format - The block's format as OMMFormat.

      • createOMMOwnerBlock

        public static OMMBlock createOMMOwnerBlock(OMMHeader header,
                                           java.lang.String ownerString)
        Given a header and a String describing the owner, creates a new owner block to be added to an OMM.
        Parameters:
        header - OMMHeader for the OMM.
        ownerString - String describing the new owner (name, user name, password).
        Returns:
        New owner block as OMMBlock.

      • createOMMOwnerStringFromUsernamePassword

        public static java.lang.String createOMMOwnerStringFromUsernamePassword(java.lang.String clearTextName,
                                                                        java.lang.String username,
                                                                        java.lang.String password)
        Given the owner information as separate Strings, creates a normed owner representation String.
        Parameters:
        clearTextName - Clear name of the owner to be displayed to the outside.
        username - Owner's username to be used internally.
        password - Password to the username.
        Returns:
        Normed owner representation String formatted as "[clearTextName][owner separator][username][credential separator][password]".

      • createOMMViaOMSRestInterface

        public static boolean createOMMViaOMSRestInterface(java.lang.String omsURL,
                                                   OMMHeader header,
                                                   OMMBlock ownerBlock)
        Creates an XML representation of the given data and sends it to the REST interface in order to create a new OMM.
        Parameters:
        omsURL - Full address of the "mgmt/createMemory" node of the REST interface.
        header - OMMHeader for the new OMM.
        ownerBlock - Owner block as OMMBlock for the new OMM.
        Returns:
        True, if creation was successful.

      • getFreeBlockID

        public static java.lang.String getFreeBlockID(OMM omm)
        Given an existing OMM, looks for a free block ID to assign to a new block.
        Parameters:
        omm - The memory in which to look for the next free block ID.
        Returns:
        The smallest available free block ID.

      • deleteOMMViaOMSRestInterface

        public static boolean deleteOMMViaOMSRestInterface(java.net.URL ommUrl)
        Deletes a memory from the OMS using the REST interface.
        Parameters:
        ommUrl - The URL to the memory, for example http://localhost:10082/rest/MemoryName/.
        Returns:
        True, if deletion was successful.

      • deleteOMMViaOMSRestInterface

        public static OMMRestImpl deleteOMMViaOMSRestInterface(OMMRestImpl omm)
        Deletes a memory from the OMS using the REST interface.
        Parameters:
        omm - The OMMRestImpl to delete from the server.
        Returns:
        Null, if deletion was successful, else the given OMM.

      • deleteOMMViaOMSRestInterface

        public static boolean deleteOMMViaOMSRestInterface(java.net.URL ommUrl,
                                                   OMSCredentials credentials)
        Deletes a memory from the OMS using the REST interface.
        Parameters:
        ommUrl - The URL to the memory, for example http://localhost:10082/rest/MemoryName/.
        credentials - The OMSCredentials to access an ACL-protected memory.
        Returns:
        True, if deletion was successful.

      • deleteOMMViaOMSRestInterface

        public static OMMRestImpl deleteOMMViaOMSRestInterface(OMMRestImpl omm,
                                                       OMSCredentials credentials)
        Deletes a memory from the OMS using the REST interface.
        Parameters:
        omm - The OMMRestImpl to delete from the server.
        credentials - The OMSCredentials to access an ACL-protected memory.
        Returns:
        Null, if deletion was successful, else the given OMM.

      • loadOMMFromXmlFileString

        public static OMM loadOMMFromXmlFileString(java.lang.String xml,
                                           java.net.URL urlSource,
                                           java.io.File fileSource,
                                           OMMSourceType sourceType)

        Loads an OMM from an XML string and a source from which the memory can be loaded when the OMS (re)starts. The source can be either a URL or a File and has to be described by a OMMSourceType.

        With one source given the other can be null, but not both.

        Parameters:
        xml - An XMl representation String of the OMM to load.
        urlSource - Source of the OMM as a URL.
        fileSource - Source of the OMM as a File.
        sourceType - The OMMSourceType of the source.
        Returns:
        The loaded memory as a OMM.

      • loadOMMFromXmlFile

        public static OMM loadOMMFromXmlFile(java.io.File xmlfile)
        Loads an OMM from a file containing a memory description in XML format.
        Parameters:
        xmlfile - The File from which to load.
        Returns:
        The loaded memory as a OMM.

      • loadOMMViaOMSRestInterface

        public static OMM loadOMMViaOMSRestInterface(java.net.URL url)
        Loads an OMM from the OMS using the REST interface.
        Parameters:
        url - The URL to the memory, for example http://localhost:10082/rest/MemoryName/.
        Returns:
        The loaded memory as a OMM.

      • loadOMMFromOMS

        public static OMM loadOMMFromOMS(java.net.URL primaryID)
        Loads an OMM from the OMS without using the REST interface.
        Parameters:
        primaryID - The memory's ID as an URL.
        Returns:
        The loaded memory as a OMM.

      • saveOMM

        public static boolean saveOMM(OMM omm,
                              boolean withToC)
        Saves an OMM to its appointed source.
        Parameters:
        omm - The OMM to save.
        withToC - True, if the table of contents is to be saved, too.
        Returns:
        True, if the memory was saved successfully.

      • saveOMM

        public static boolean saveOMM(OMM omm,
                              OMMEntity entity,
                              boolean withToC)
                       throws java.lang.Exception
        Saves an OMM to its appointed source.
        Parameters:
        omm - The OMM to save.
        entity - The OMMEntity issuing the save operation. Must not be null when saving to the OMS.
        withToC - True, if the table of contents is to be saved, too.
        Returns:
        True, if the memory was saved successfully.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - For illegal arguments or save operations.

      • saveOMMToXmlFile

        public static boolean saveOMMToXmlFile(OMM omm,
                                       java.io.File xmlFile,
                                       boolean withToC)
        Saves an XML memory representation of an OMM to a file.
        Parameters:
        omm - The OMM to save.
        xmlFile - A File in which to store the memory.
        withToC - True, if the table of contents is to be saved, too.
        Returns:
        True, if the memory was saved successfully.
